item.title: [HBASE-783] For single row, single family retrieval, getRow() works half as fast as getScanner().next()
item.description:
We have a very typical use-case of wanting to retrieve all columns under a single row, single family.

Benchmarking regularly reproduces the same result. Using HTable.getScanner().next() to get the RowResult works twice as fast as HTable.getRow().

This is related to HBASE-631 by jdcryans which added this functionality to getRow().
item.summary: For single row, single family retrieval, getRow() works half as fast as getScanner().next()

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Jonathan, try this patch to see if it's faster (it should).

Patch appears to improve performance to the same level as using getScanner.next

This is only in the case of getting all columns for a family.

Not directly related to this issue, but when getting a subset of columns in a single family, getScanner is still twice as fast as getRow.

On IRC:
<jdcryans> jim_kellerman: Should I expect HStore.getFull to be slower than a scanner when fetching a particular set of column keys all from the same family?
<jim_kellerman> y, gets are slower than scans

So getting more performance for a subset of columns for a getRow is not in this jira scope.

Review my patch please. It removes a lot of useless scanning in particular situations.

Passes the tests
